definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: I am an honest and kind minded man.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個誠實，善良，沒有門戶之見的人。

sentences.english: The presidential candidate seemed to be very partisan.
sentences.chinese: 這名總統候選人的門戶之見似乎很深。

definition: to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
wine, sex, avarice and temper (idiom); four cardinal vices
